citation.article-title: Ancylobacter dichloromethanicus sp. nov. – a new aerobic facultatively methylotrophic bacterium utilizing dichloromethane

p.s: Description of Ancylobacter dichloromethanicus sp. nov.

A. dichloromethanicus (di.chlo.ro.me.tha.ni.cus. N.L. n. dichloromethanum, dichloromethane; L. suff. – icus – a – um, suffix used with various meanings; N.L. masc. adj. dichloromethanicus, dichloromethane utilizing).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-sporulating, colorless, non-motile curved rods having no capsule and multiplying by binary fission.
Colonies on methanol agar are round, low convex, smooth, with entire edge, of homogeneous consistency, semitransparent and colorless, up to 0.6 mm in diameter.
Obligate aerobe.
Unable to produce H2S.
Indole is produced from tryptophan on a medium with nitrate as nitrogen source.
It does not reduce nitrates to nitrites.
The bacterium hydrolyzed aesculin but not starch, gelatin, or casein milk.
Facultative methylotroph and chemolithoautotroph using thiosulfate as an energy source.
Assimilates C1 compounds via the RuBP pathway.
Autotrophic growth occurs on mineral salt medium with gas mixture of H2/O2/CO2, dichloromethane, methanol, formate and formaldehyde.
Utilizes a variety of polycarbon compounds.
Ammonium salts, nitrates, glutamate and urea serve as nitrogen sources.
Urease, catalase, oxidase and β-galactosidase positive.
Neutrophilic and mesophilic.
Grows at pH 6.0–9.0 and temperatures 4–37 °C.
Optimal growth at pH 7.0–7.5 and temperatures 28–30 °C.
No growth in the presence of 2% NaCl (w/v).
Contains ubiquinone Q-10.
Dominant phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol (cardiolipin).
The prevailing cellular fatty acids are 18:1ω7c (58.6%), cyclo-19:0ω8c (34.8%) and 16:0 (3.2%).
The major polyamines are putrescine, homospermidine and spermine.

Utilizable carbon sources are dichloromethane, methanol, formate, formaldehyde, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-maltose, d-raffinose, d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-melibiose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-mannitol, d-adonitol, d-arabitol, xylitol, α-ketoglutarate, succinate, propionate, gluconate, 5-ketogluconate, l-alanine, l-arginine, serine, inositol, sorbitol, glycerol, salicin and sarcosine.

The following compounds are not utilized: sucrose, d-lactose, trehalose, cellobiose, l-rhamnose, malate, fumarate, glutamate, pyruvate, citrate, acetate, dulcitol, ethanol, l-valine, glycine, tryptophan, acetone, dimethylsulfoxide, mono-, di- and trimethylamines and acetamide.
Biotin and pantothenate are required for good growth on most substrates.
Resistant to linkomycin, novobiocin, oxacillin and nalidixic acid, but sensitive to ampicillin, neomycin, streptomycin and gentamycin.
The DNA G+C content is 64.5 mol% (Tm).
The type strain is DM16T (DSM 21507T=VKM B-2484T) isolated from contaminated soil sampled at Volgograd chemical plant (Russia).
The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence is EU589386.
